meanings.definition: To remove impurities or unwanted elements from a substance.
meanings.sent1: I will refine the sugar to make it pure.
meanings.sent2: She used a filter to refine the water and make it clean.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to refine the soup, but accidentally added too much salt.
meanings.sent4: His skills in refining metals were as sharp as a sword.
meanings.sent5: The process to refine gold requires patience and precision.

meanings.definition: To improve or perfect by small changes or additions.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to refine his painting by adding more details.
meanings.sent2: She decided to refine her essay by revising the conclusion.
meanings.sent3: The students worked together to refine their project for the science fair.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to refine her dance moves was like watching a flower bloom.
meanings.sent5: The artist's dedication to refine his craft was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: To make more cultured or polished.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to refine her manners to impress her guests.
meanings.sent2: He tried to refine his speech to sound more professional.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's attempt to refine his jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her refined taste in music was like a symphony to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina's movements were refined and graceful on stage.
